articles.author: Jeff Mason
articles.description: President Joe Biden will host President-elect Donald Trump at the White House on Wednesday for a meeting designed to demonstrate a smooth transition between administrations despite Trump's team not yet having signed documents to start the handover process.
articles.title: Biden, Trump to meet at White House for transition talks after Harris defeat

articles.author: John Irish, Francois Murphy
articles.description: The resolution would task the IAEA with issuing a "comprehensive report" on Iran's nuclear activities, which would put further focus on Iran's failure to explain uranium traces found at undeclared sites.
articles.title: Exclusive: European powers pushing for resolution against Iran at IAEA, diplomats say

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden will meet Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping for likely the final time on Saturday, senior administration officials said, as Beijing prepares for a potentially more confrontational period with Washington under Donald Trump.
articles.title: Biden, Xi to meet on Saturday in Peru, US officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian forces on Wednesday repelled an attempt by Russian troops to pierce defences near the northeastern city of Kupiansk, Ukraine's General Staff said.
articles.title: Ukrainian forces repel Russian bid to pierce defences in northeast, General Staff says

articles.author: Marine Strauss
articles.description: The Paris prosecutor on Wednesday requested a five-year prison sentence and a five-year ban from public office against far-right leader Marine Le Pen, at a trial where she and 24 others are accused of embezzling European Union funds.
articles.title: French prosecutor seeks 5-year ban from office against French far right leader Le Pen

articles.author: Andrew Gray
articles.description: European Union foreign policy chief Josep Borrell has proposed that the bloc suspend a political dialogue with Israel, citing possible human rights violations in the war in Gaza, according to four diplomats and a letter seen by Reuters.
articles.title: EU's Borrell proposes suspending Israel dialogue over Gaza war concerns

articles.author: Stephanie Burnett
articles.description: Police detained pro-Palestinian protesters rallying in central Amsterdam on Wednesday in defiance of a ban imposed after violence stemming from a football match between Ajax and Israeli club Maccabi Tel Aviv.
articles.title: Police detain pro-Palestinian protesters defying Amsterdam ban

articles.author: David Morgan, Bo Erickson
articles.description: U.S. Senate Republicans elected John Thune to lead the chamber next year, opting for a well-regarded insider and shrugging off a public pressure campaign by supporters of Donald Trump to pick a loyalist to the president-elect.
articles.title: US Senate Republicans pick insider John Thune as their next leader

articles.author: Michael Gore, Vincent West, Jon Nazca
articles.description: Spaniards braced for further heavy rain and storms on Wednesday, just two weeks after rain and flash floods prompted rivers to overflow in Valencia and other parts of Spain, killing more than 200 people and destroying homes and property.
articles.title: Spaniards brace for fresh storms two weeks after deadly Valencia floods

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli officials are insisting on maintaining a capacity to strike Lebanon at any moment as part of conditions to secure a ceasefire with Iran-backed Hezbollah, France's foreign minister said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Israel wants freedom to strike Lebanon even after ceasefire, France says
